Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Plantaricin W (plw, natural AMPs; a two-chain lantibiotic, type 2, class 1 bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes, XXT;  UCSS2b; 1S=S; JJsn)

Literature Information.Literature: Molecular form: Shown in chain alpha and the sequence of chain beta is GDPEARSGIPCTIGAAVAASIAVCPTTKCSKRCGKRKK. It shows sequence homology to another two two-chain lantibiotics: lacticin 3147 and staphylococcin C55.Activity: Both chains have inherent activitiesSynergy:AMPs:  but work best and synergistically at a 1:1 ratio.SAR:  The oxidation state of the two Cys residues appear not to be essential for activity.
Literature Information.Author: Holo H, Jeknic Z, Daeschel M, Stevanovic S, Nes IF2001
Literature Information.Title: Plantaricin W from Lactobacillus plantarum belongs to a new family of two-peptide lantibiotics.
